isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - AIR-TO-AIR CHARGE AIR COOLER - CLEAN AND INSPECT - PERIODIC INSPECTION

svcproc.title: PERIODIC INSPECTION
svcproc.para: Inspect the charge air cooler for damage and leaks AT EACH OIL CHANGE:

step1.para: Thoroughly clean the exterior of the charge air cooler, using the following procedure:

step2.para: Disconnect the cooler at the inlet and outlet manifolds. Remove the inlet and outlet air hoses. Disassemble and reserve the fasteners holding the unit on the radiator bracket, then remove the unit from the vehicle.

caution.para: To prevent foreign matter from entering the engine, cover the turbocharger outlet and the engine intake manifold while the piping is disassembled.

step2.para: Blow the steam or air through the cooler core toward the front, opposite normal vehicle airflow.

Put the cooler assembly into a tank containing non-caustic cleaner (a solution of mild liquid detergent and water works well). Submerge the ENTIRE CORE of the unit, and allow it to soak for at least 30 minutes.

note.para: Either seal off the manifold pipes, or keep them above the fluid level, to avoid getting solution into the cooler.

step2.para: Remove the cooler assembly from the tank and repeat Step B.
Drain any liquid that may have seeped into the charge air cooler and allow the unit to dry completely. If necessary, you can force-dry the inside of the core with pressurized air.

Re-install the cooler assembly to the vehicle. Check mounting brackets for security and condition. Connect all air hoses, and tighten the hose clamps to the values found in the TORQUE CHART
.

step1.para: Use a small screwdriver, or a pair of small needle-nose pliers to CAREFULLY straighten bent fins. Fins are made of thin strips of aluminum alloy, and are quite malleable.

Check the security of the hose clamps; tighten all clamps to the values found in the TORQUE CHART
.

note.para:
Check spring-loaded clamps to see if there is sufficient bridge gap ( Figure 9) when the clamp is torqued to the value found in the TORQUE CHART
. If the bridge gap has been taken up, replace the clamp with the next smaller diameter.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. MINIMUM BRIDGE GAP AT RECOMMENDED TORQUE VALUE TO BE 1/8 INCH (3 MM)
